result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Loring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to prision on 1-10-20; unpaid court obligations of $3,767 and supervision fees of $40
Associated with Charge #1

03:04 PM Defendant Brian E Loring in court, in custody with attorney Claire M Edwards.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendations argued. State recommended prison with argument. Atty Edwards recommended jail sentence with argument. Defendant apologized to Court. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 years in prison, consecutive to any other. 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supersvision. A civil judgment will be entered for the unpaid financial obligations. 136 days jail credit. Defendant is eligible for the challenge incarceration program and substance abuse program.

records.addlTxt: To Stay Judgment of Conviction Pending Appeal filed by Atty Charles Giesen
Filed by defendant/counsel.
Ct 1:  Operating with Restricted Controlled Substance in Blood 5th or 6th offense.  Ct 2:  Possess Drug Paraphernalia.

ADA Cliff Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Charles Giesen.  Joint recommendation. Amended Information filed.  Ct 1 amended to Operating with Restricted Controlled Substance 5th or 6th offense.   Rights/elements.   No contest plea to Ct 1.  Adjudged guilty, JOC entered.  Ct 2 dismissed/read in.  Victim rights complied with.  Arguments.  Statement by family member and defendant. Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions:  9 months jail with huber stayed but it must be completed before end of probation.   May be served in Dane County.  Fine $3467.00 to probation.  36 month revocation/36 month interlock/AODA and comply.  DNA sample and surcharge.  3 days jail credit.  Order Denying Motion to Suppress Chemical Test Evidence filed by Atty Giesen;  signed by court.  Notice of Intent to File Post Conviction Relief filed by Atty Giesen.  ADA Burdon objects to stay and requests jail commence forthwith.  Civil rights and firearm restriction cited.  Court stays jail.  3:41 pm/4:35pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Brenda Yaskal
